definition: lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
common snipe/sandpiper
abbr. for Bengbu prefecture-level city 蚌埠市[Beng4 bu4 shi4], Anhui
mussel/clam
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
lit. sandpiper and clam war together and the fisherman catches both (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
pinyin: yu4 bang4 xiang1 zheng1 , yu2 weng1 de2 li4

sentences.english: But for property buyers are concerned, it is common snipe mussels competing and profit.
sentences.chinese: 但对于购房者来讲，却是鹬蚌相争，渔翁得利。

sentences.english: Lai I repeatedly promise, want to see the play.
sentences.chinese: 赖爷连连答应，要看鹬蚌相争。

sentences.english: With skill, Nepal could play one off against the other.
sentences.chinese: 尼泊尔可以坐看鹬蚌相争。

definition: lit. sandpiper and clam war together and the fisherman catches both (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
pinyin: yu4 bang4 xiang1 zheng1 , yu2 weng1 de2 li4

definition: the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
two tigers fight (idiom); fig. a dispute between two powerful adversaries/a battle of the giants
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger

definition: if two tigers fight, one will get injured (idiom)/if you start a war, someone is bound to get hurt
pinyin: liang3 hu3 xiang1 zheng1 , bi4 you3 yi1 shang1

definition: to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
